div.p: This page summarizes the main changes that have happened between releases of the implementation guide

Key changes in this release from the version that went to ballot are below. Where applicable, links are included to the associated Jira issue. In addition to these, a number of other non-substantive changes that clarify or improve wording and/or fix minor errors were applied.

ul.li: Made support for the Coverage Information card mandatory (FHIR-37484)
Made support for system action mandatory for coverage information and 'MAY' for request form completion and create/update coverage information (FHIR-37484)
Dropped using SMART launch for DTR and deferred launch (FHIR-33124, FHIR-39452)

Additional changes to the coverage-information extension:
Add assertion of dependencies between a coverage assertion and other orders it might be dependent on (FHIR-40660)
Added support for questionnaires and responses coming back with coverage information, and guidance about how QRs should be represented (FHIR-40603)
Split the 'code' element into a number of properties that distinctly convey coverage, prior authorization, documentation requirements, need for additional information, etc. As well, split the identifier into an assertion id and a prior auth satisfied id (FHIR-41435)
Added guidance on metrics
Added guidance on ePA coordinators

div.p: Substantive changes in this release from the first official release are below. Where applicable, links are included to the associated Jira issue. In addition to these, a number of other non-substantive changes that clarify or improve wording and/or fix minor errors were applied.

ul.li:
Various updates to the coverage-information extension, including:
Added ability to link to which requests or other resources are associated with a card (FHIR-33252).
Added a code to indicate the overall assertion (covered, not covered, prior auth required, clinical DTR needed, administrative DTR needed) - (FHIR-33225)
Added link to the specific coverage the information applies to (FHIR-33225)
Added date assertion was made (FHIR-33225)
Added an identifier for traceability (FHIR-33225)
Added 'reason' for the coverage assertion (FHIR-36442)
Added a 'detail' structure to convey additional information about the coverage assertion (FHIR-36477)
Added ability to include a 'contact' for follow-up about a coverage assertion (FHIR-37817)
Defined a standard list of card types (FHIR-11895)
Add support for system action as an optional sharing approach (FHIR-34216)
Added rules requiring hooks to only be sent to payers where patient has active coverage (FHIR-34102)

Removed mustSupport from the 'insurance' elements in the various Request resources, as well as dropping the extension introduced to those resources that did not have an 'insurance' element (FHIR-36746)

div.p: Key changes in this release from the version that went to ballot are below. Where applicable, links are included to the associated Jira issue. In addition to these, a number of other non-substantive changes that clarify or improve wording and/or fix minor errors were applied.

ul.li: Updated CapabilityStatements to be based on US Core and revised conformance expectations for many of the operations. Also added expectations on Patient, Practitioner and other registry resources (FHIR-40796, FHIR-40767, FHIR-40751)

For the different profiles, use 'activity' rather than 'social history' as the category to satisfy US Core and make the Physical Activity category mandatory (FHIR-41295, FHIR-41114, FHIR-41037, FHIR-40776)
For the different observations, remove the prohibition on Observation.bodySite (FHIR-41086)
Added 'patient experience' to the set of activity measures (FHIR-41362)
Added average heart rate as an activity measure (FHIR-40952)
Tightened the condition statuses to those relevant for physical activity (FHIR-41362)
For goal, require at least one of description and target, tighten expectations on Quantity, and allow pointing to any physical activity measure codes (FHIR-41294)
For DiagnosticReport, made the report type extensible (FHIR-41293)
For ServiceRequest, added a 'notes' section, constrained allowed statuses, made authoredOn and requester mandatory, and require either reasonCode or reasonReference (FHIR-41291)
For Task for Referral, made Task.reason, Task.owner and Task.requester 1..1 (FHIR-41295, FHIR-41206)
For RelatedPerson, set conformance expectations for elements in telecom and address (FHIR-41295)
For subscription, change to use the official R4 code (FHIR-41053)

div.p: This was the first version of the specification intended for ballot review. It included the physical activity vital signs, the initial set of time-based and activity-based measures, as well as support for goals, planns, and referral workflow.
